name: Monthly distance traveled by robotaxi passengers
descriptionShort: The total distance that passengers travel each month in California's paid driverless taxi services, calculated by summing, across all trips, the number of passengers multiplied by the miles each one travels.
descriptionProcessing: We combined trip data from all approved robotaxi companies in California. Both Cruise and Waymo are included until September 2024. After that, only Waymo remains, as Cruise ended its service.
datasetName: CPUC AV Passenger Service Deployment programs - Quarterly Reports
descriptionKey: This measures how far people have traveled in paid robotaxi trips that are approved to operate in California.

The calculation multiplies passengers by distance. So if 3 people share a 5-mile ride, that's 15 passenger-miles. For rides where passengers get in or out partway, each part of the trip is counted based on how many people were actually in the car.
Excludes empty cars driving between pickups, test rides, and any non-passenger travel.

Originally both Cruise and Waymo reported this data. Cruise stopped operating in late 2023 due to safety and regulatory issues. From 2024 onward, Waymo is the only company authorized to operate paid robotaxi services in California and the sole reporter of this data.

origins.title: CPUC AV Passenger Service Deployment programs - Quarterly Reports
origins.description: The dataset contains quarterly reports submitted to the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) by carriers in the AV Passenger Service Deployment programs. Reports cover AV passenger service operations statewide and include disaggregated incident records.
